conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to determine when the particle is farthest from the starting point based on the given acceleration-time graph.
The acceleration-time graph shows that the acceleration changes over time as follows: From t = 0 to t = t0/2, the acceleration increases linearly from 0 to a0.
From t = t0/2 to t = t0, the acceleration decreases linearly from a0 to 0.
From t = t0 to t = 3t0/2, the acceleration decreases linearly from 0 to -a0.
From t = 3t0/2 to t = 2t0, the acceleration increases linearly from -a0 to 0.
The velocity is the integral of the acceleration with respect to time.

premise: The velocity-time graph derived from the acceleration-time graph.
conclusion: At t = 2t0, the particle is farthest from the starting point.
